page.title: 16 Cornish dialect
page.content:
Dialect is very much to be heard and is especially strong within farming families. For example:- {" Oh!you have had your hair cut." becomes { "Oh!'ers 'ad 'er 'air 'cut."
{ "We are going to town"}becomes { "Us be goin' to town"
Asking{"Where is it?" }becomes {"Where's it to?"
A farmer would say{"Cows 'av got wap" meaning they are being tormented by the Warble fly.
Wood that is going rotten is said to be{"Drixie." Visitors or holiday makers are called {"Emmits." The familiar potato is called{"Tatty."
